msContents.summary: A woman sells her property and mentions that she will not impede or allow any body to impede the other party. If she didn���t she will pay amount of 13100 (deben) of silver as offerings.

condition.ab: The papyrus consists of 6 fragments. It has a light brown color. Some parts are missing, probably because it was vertically folded. It preserves the lower margin, about 12 cm. Some restoration needs to be done on this papyrus. (MA)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Aphroditopolis; As a part of a Goddess name.

div.ab: [. . . . ] I will not impede thee; I will not cause thee to be impeded, [ . . . . ] any man in the world [ . . . . ] . if I impede thee, (2) if I cause thee to be impeded, [if any man] in the world impedes thee in my [name . . . . ], I will [cause them to be far] from thee (on) a day [within] five days, if I [do not cause them to be far from thee], I will give [131]00 (deben) of silver to the burnt offerings and the [libations] of Pharaoh P[tolemy, (son of) Ptolemy, in the] month, and thou shalt have claim on [me] to cause them to be far from thee again, without citing any matter in the world against thee.;(3) the farmer, the servant of Hat[hor-mistress-of-]Aphroditopolis; [Isis, the] great [goddess, Pete]armotis, (son of) Patous, (his) mother (being) Nebwotis, her husband, [says, Receive the document of] <specie> payment and the document of cession aforesaid pertaining to the half part of the house together with the half part of [its courtyard], the measurements of which and the neighbors of which are above, from the hand of the woman Tikas, daughter of Teos, my wife, aforesaid, do everything (4) aforesaid, my heart [ is satisfied therewith].;Nechutes, (son of) . . . . . . has written (it).;Nechutes son of . . .;;Verso;[. . . . ], (son of) [Psenesis;[. . . . ], (son of) . . . .
